What's New

Sri Lanka +94

Number Format

Area Code: 1-2 digits Subscriber Number: 4-6 digits Trunk Prefix: 0 International Prefix: 00

Area code information

DCCL

1 June 2003 - 8 November 2003: expansion to national 10-digit numbering

As mandated by Telecommunications Regulatory Commission, Sri Lanka began conversion 1 June 2003 to a national 10-digit numbering plan (area code plus subscriber number totals 10 digits, including trunk prefix '0').

Generally '2' is prepended to existing 6-digit fixed subscriber numbers, and '22' is prepended to existing 5-digit fixed subscriber numbers. New subscriber numbers are standardised at 7 digits, with geographic area codes standardised at 2 digits. When the trunk prefix is included, there would be a consistent total of 10 digits for Sri Lanka telephone numbers.

Non-geographic codes are migrated to the new format as indicated in the sections below.

Nationwide standard short codes for emergency services will also be implemented, with timings to be determined:

Ambulance / Regional 110 Fire / Regional 111 Emergency / Regional 112 Emergency / Central 119

Uniform 4-digit short codes will be standardised for all operators to access services such as complaints, directory inquiries, fault reports.

The changes were scheduled as a 10-phase programme, beginning 1 June 2003 and continuing with scheduled changes until 8 November 2003.

See this document from regulator TRC (posted via ITU) for number change schedule phasing.

Also see TRC-SL press page, with Media Release (.pdf format).

Subscriber numbers in Jaffna Area (+94 21) already changed to the 10-digit format in September 2002.

Phase 1: 1 June 2003 - Ja-Ela, Katunayake, Mannar, Panadura

The initial numbering changes occurred in selected places as follows:

Place Old numbering New numbering ===== ============= ============= Ja-Ela and Katunayake +94 1 2xxxxx +94 1 22xxxxx Mannar +94 23 xxxxx +94 23 22xxxxx Panadura +94 38 xxxxx +94 38 22xxxxx

Only the Ja-Ela and Katunayake exchanges of Colombo district will change, where subscriber numbers begin with '2'. Other Colombo numbers change 16 August 2003 (Phase 4).

Reference: Sri Lanka Telecom - News.

Phase 2: 28 June 2003 - various locations

'2' or '22' was prepended to subscriber numbers beginning with '2' in the following areas on 28 June 2003:

Place Old numbering New numbering ===== ============= ============= Galle +94 9 2xxxx +94 9 222xxxx Gampaha +94 33 2xxxx +94 33 222xxxx Hambantota +94 47 2xxxx +94 47 222xxxx Kalutara +94 34 2xxxx +94 34 222xxxx Kandy +94 8 2xxxxx +94 8 22xxxxx Kurunegala +94 37 2xxxxx +94 37 222xxxx Ratnapura +94 45 2xxxx +94 45 222xxxx

Subscriber numbers in these area codes that did not begin with '2' will be changed on 13 September 2003 (Phase 6) except for Horana exchange numbers in +94 34 which will be changed 16 August 2003 (Phase 4).

Reference: Sri Lanka Telecom - News.

Phase 3: 9 August 2003 - Trincomalee

'22' was prepended to all Trincomalee (+94 26) subscriber numbers on 9 August 2003. That is, +94 26 xxxxx became +94 26 22xxxxx.

Reference: Sri Lanka Telecom - News.

Phase 4: 16 August 2003 - Colombo Metro and Horana

On 16 August 2003, '2' was prepended to all remaining Colombo area (+94 1) subscriber numbers that were not changed on Phase 1 on 1 June 2003.

That is, +94 1 xxxxxx became +94 1 2xxxxxx, provided the first digit of the old 6-digit subscriber number was not '2', due to the earlier Phase 1 conversion in Ja-Ela and Katunayake. Subscriber numbers in Colombo do not begin with digits '0' or '1'.

Also on 16 August 2003, '22' was prepended to Horana exchange subscriber numbers in the Kalutara area (+94 34). The old +94 34 2xxxx numbers were already converted in Phase 2 of 28 June 2003. Remaining exchanges in +94 34 will be converted 13 September 2003 (Phase 6).

Horana exchange ranges changed in this phase:

Old numbering New numbering ============= ============= +94 34 50xxx +94 34 2250xxx +94 34 51xxx +94 34 2251xxx +94 34 52xxx +94 34 2252xxx +94 34 54xxx +94 34 2254xxx +94 34 56xxx +94 34 2256xxx +94 34 57xxx +94 34 2257xxx +94 34 6xxxx +94 34 226xxxx

Reference: Sri Lanka Telecom - News.

Phase 5: 30 August 2003 - various locations

On 30 August 2003, '22' was prepended to all subscriber numbers in the following communities:

Place Old numbering New numbering ===== ============= ============= Ampara +94 63 xxxxx +94 63 22xxxxx Anuradhapura +94 25 xxxxx +94 25 22xxxxx Awissawella +94 36 xxxxx +94 36 22xxxxx Badulla +94 55 xxxxx +94 55 22xxxxx Bandarawela +94 57 xxxxx +94 57 22xxxxx Batticaloa +94 65 xxxxx +94 65 22xxxxx Chilaw +94 32 xxxxx +94 32 22xxxxx Hatton +94 51 xxxxx +94 51 22xxxxx Kalmunai +94 67 xxxxx +94 67 22xxxxx Kegalle +94 35 xxxxx +94 35 22xxxxx Matale +94 66 xxxxx +94 66 22xxxxx Nawalapitiya +94 54 xxxxx +94 54 22xxxxx Negombo +94 31 xxxxx +94 31 22xxxxx Nuwara Eliya +94 52 xxxxx +94 52 22xxxxx Polonnaruwa +94 27 xxxxx +94 27 22xxxxx Vavuniya +94 24 xxxxx +94 24 22xxxxx

Reference: Sri Lanka Telecom - News.

Phase 6: 13 September 2003 - various locations

On 13 September 2003, '22' was prepended to all subscriber numbers in the following communities (except Kandy, where '2' was prepended to 6-digit subscriber numbers there):

Place Old numbering New numbering ===== ============= ============= Galle +94 9 xxxxx +94 9 22xxxxx Gampaha +94 33 xxxxx +94 33 22xxxxx Hambantota +94 47 xxxxx +94 47 22xxxxx Kurunegala +94 37 xxxxx +94 37 22xxxxx Ratnapura +94 45 xxxxx +94 45 22xxxxx Kalutara +94 34 3xxxx +94 34 223xxxx Kalutara +94 34 4xxxx +94 34 224xxxx Kalutara +94 34 55xxx +94 34 2255xxx Kalutara +94 34 58xxx +94 34 2258xxx Kalutara +94 34 7xxxx +94 34 227xxxx Kalutara +94 34 8xxxx +94 34 228xxxx Kalutara +94 34 9xxxx +94 34 229xxxx Kandy +94 8 xxxxxx +94 8 2xxxxxx

Phase 7: 4 October 2003 - Matara and national non-geographic network

'22' is prepended to existing 5-digit subscriber numbers in Matara (+94 41) on 4 October 2003, to form new numbering of format +94 41 22xxxxx.

Also on this date, the national non-geographic overlay network changes area code from +94 70 to +94 60. '2' is also prepended to existing 6-digit subscriber numbers. That is, +94 70 xxxxxx becomes +94 60 2xxxxxx.

Phase 8: 18 October 2003 - new area codes in Colombo, Galle, Kandy

'1' will be appended to area codes in these localities:

Place Old code New code ===== ======== ======== Colombo +94 1 +94 11 Galle +94 9 +94 91 Kandy +94 8 +94 81

Other area codes in Sri Lanka are not affected by the national renumbering. This phase will standardise the length of area codes in Sri Lanka to 2 digits exclusive of trunk prefix.

Phase 9: 1 November 2003 - private network changes

Sri Lankan Airlines private network numbering changes from +94 73 xxxx to +94 1973 3xxxx. That is, '19' is prepended to the area code portion, and '3' is prepended to the 4-digit subscriber number portion. This is a special case numbering.

Phase 10: 8 November 2003 - WLL area code and subscriber number changes

In this final phase of changes for the 2003 national renumbering, Wireless Local Loop (WLL) numbers change from non-geographic to geographic area codes.

Migration is based on which WLL carrier operates service:

1) Suntel existing non-geographic area code is +94 74. The digit '4' will be prepended to the subscriber number, and the area code changed to the geographic region in which the number is located.

2) Lanka Bell existing non-geographic area code is +94 75. The digit '5' will be prepended to the subscriber number, and the area code changed to the geographic region in which the number is located.

For example a Suntel WLL customer in Negombo changes from +94 74 87xxxx to +94 31 487xxxx. A Lanka Tel WLL customer in the same centre changes from +94 75 31xxxx to +94 31 531xxxx. The non-geographic codes +94 74 and +94 75 would be decommissioned once the geographic format numbers are established. There is no indication of permissive dialling of old and new formats for WLL numbers.

The following indicates WLL migration by order of number range:

+94 27 587xxxx Polonnaruwa

Cellular mobile changes

MTN Networks (Dialog) (+94 77) already had '7' prepended to existing 6-digit subscriber numbers to form 7-digit numbers in 2002.

31 May 2003: '2' prepended to existing 6-digit Celltel numbers (+94 72)

7 June 2003: '2' prepended to existing 6-digit Mobitel numbers (+94 71)

1 August 2003 (tentative): Lanka Cellular Services/Hutchison (+94 78) expands from 6- to 7-digit numbers. It was unclear whether '2' was to be prepended to existing Lanka Cellular 6-digit subscriber numbers.

(some news tips, updates courtesy Ken Westmoreland)

1999-2000 - preliminary national renumbering plans

Sri Lanka's Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC) has informed WTNG in August 1999 that Sri Lanka's numbering plan will be converted to an 8-digit "closed" numbering plan within the next three years. No further details from TRC were available at that time.

However, there was disagreement to a new TRC numbering plan from Sri Lanka Telecom, which wants to wait until it can re-balance its tariffs. There was a suggestion that the new numbering plan conversion could begin in 2001. Source: "Regulator in numbers crunch" in Sunday Times.

April-July 1996 - various local changes

Around 19 April 1996:

The area code for Panadura changed from +94 1 to +94 34 around 19 April 1996. Existing 6-digit subscriber numbers were converted to 5-digit format to fit into the new area code.

New numbers in Bandaragama are of the format +94 34 90xxx or +94 34 91xxx.

In Kandy, some 5-digit subscriber numbers in its area code +94 8 were extended to 6-digit format by prepending digit '2'.

In Piliyandala (Colombo area, +94 1), subscriber numbers in the 504xxx range were changed to 614xxx.

Around 29 June 1996:

Some subscriber numbers in Ja-Ela (Colombo area, +94 1 area code) changed. Existing numbers 536xxx and 537xxx were changed to 236xxx and 237xxx respectively. 231xxx and 232xxx number ranges also entered into service.

Hikkaduwa subscriber numbers (under area code +94 9) changed from 57xxx to 77xxx. The area code did not change.

13 July 1996, in Hatton, area code changed from +94 512 to +94 51; '22' was prepended to the existing 3-digit subscriber numbers to form new 5-digit subscriber numbers.

Reference: http://home.vicnet.net.au/~slanka/telch.html, unofficial report from Australian source

Other information

Regulator is Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC)

Carrier is Sri Lanka Telecom

Another carrier is Lanka Bell.
